After nearly a month of anxiously awaiting its arrival, Halloween had finally come to the neighborhood - and by extension the Matsu household. The sextuplets has put the bare minimum into decorating but it was the thought that counted in the minds of the two youngest brothers. Jyushi and Totty were really the reason that any effort at all had been put into celebrating, seeing as they were the only two that wanted to participate in the activities. 

They could still get away with trick or treating thanks to their youthful appearances and cheerful dispositions. And if they hadn’t put so much work into their costumes since coming up with the ideas, they surely would have been in charge of decorating the house as well. But the two wouldn’t let their brothers’ lack of spirit damper their own since they were already planning on going out for a night of fun.

They spend about an hour or so just walking in through their neighborhood in costume. Jyushi, having chosen to be a werewolf, just wearing some older, torn clothes with the addition of a tail and ears. And Totty, whose take on a mermaid was summed up in scales drawn on his bare torso and a long skirt that he’d sewn to look like a tail.

Just when they’re about to head home they spot a house that they swear they’ve never seen before - and one that looks like a genuine haunted mansion. The two share a curious glance when they spot a sign in the yard advertising a free monster house. 

“I’m interested if you don’t think you’ll get too scared,” Totty teases, already walking up the pathway with Jyushi following at his heels.

“As if!” His brother responds, pushing open the door to reveal a seemingly empty house.

Unbeknownst to the two brothers, the haunted mansion in question is genuinely cursed, housing real monsters that had once been curious humans. The moment the brothers step inside seals their fate as permanent residents of the house.

With haunted houses being a popular Halloween attraction, it was fairly easy to lure interested people inside and toy with them however the monsters liked. All sorts of creatures lurked here, from mummies to ghosts to snake-like creatures. And all of them wanted to play with the new guests.

The door shuts behind the two once they step inside, locking them in complete darkness. For a while, it's completely silent.

Then a blue light appears in front of them, circling around them to tie them together. The bindings are an ethereal sort, colored blue like the light the circled them.

Creaking floorboards fill the room, shadowy figures creeping closer and closer to the bound brothers.

Jyushi is the first to notice the click of the door locking behind them but passes it off as the beginning of their genuine haunted house experience. He had to give it to the home owners, he couldn’t make out what sort of device was used to make the door shut with no one around.

It also does its job of scaring Totty, despite his confident words right before entering the house. His first reaction is to cling to his brother’s arm as they make their first steps to venture further into the house.

They both yelp in surprise when the blue light appears, sharing an amused laugh when it hovers in front of them. Just a harmless jump scare then. The two hardly have time to react when it starts moving again and they end up tied together face to face. 

“Jyushi!”

“It wasn’t me!”

The short lived squabble grinds to a halt when they notice the approaching shadows, swallowing nervously until Jyushi has the sense to speak up.

“Uhh...this is a real cool haunted house and all but I think we got a little tangled up in the decorations?”

The sound of wicked laughter surrounds the brothers in response to Jyushi's naive words. Their bonds squeeze them tighter as a lone figure approaches them, the darkness obscuring most of their face.

"It's been a long time since we've gotten any visitors." By the voice it's clear that the person speaking is male. "You seem frightened, but that is to be expected."

He steps close enough to the light for his face to be revealed, his skin as pale as snow and fangs showing through his smile.

"These are no mere decorations," he explains. "They are wisps of light, and they can't be broken. You'll be stuck like that for as long as we want you to."

He reaches out his cold hands to touch Totty and Jyushi's faces as he says his final piece.

"You're going to make wonderful additions to our collection of permanent guests."

“Well I can see why,” complains Totty. “This has to be some kind of safety hazard. I wouldn’t have even wanted to come if I’d known this would happen.”

“Shut up Totty!” Jyushi hisses as the man reveals himself and begins to explain.

He was just a tad quicker to realize what wa sharpening than his brother and he didn’t want Totty’s rudeness to land them in even more trouble. If they stuck this out they’d likely be let go within the hour.

Or not. They both whimper as the man touches them and speaks of permanent guests. Even worse that he mentions a collection. The inhabitants of the house had likely been doing this for a while without anyone’s notice.

The vampire smirks as Totty and Jyushi whimper under his touch. It had been a long time since he had come into contact with new victims, forgetting how much fun it was to torment and scare them.

"We have a few monsters in here that we keep as pets," he says, offering an explanation about the collection. "Once human, these monsters either join us in capturing new guests, or stay as our playthings forever. I have a feeling that we're going to have a lot of fun together, my dear guests."
